Why do so many Western politicians and economists promote a trading system that increases Western unemployment levels and results in a gigantic transfer of wealth to the East every year?

Since 2000 many jobs have moved from Europe and America to Asia.Â  China, Taiwan, South Korea, Malaysia, and the Philippines have seen a huge rise in manufacturing jobs and India has taken a chunk out of back office service sector jobs.Â  A large number of the products and services produced in Asia have been exported back to Europe and America.

For many this is clearly a good thing.Â  Asia is becoming more affluent and millions of people have been pulled out of poverty.Â  For others this is a bad thing. Â  The trend causes a huge trade imbalance for the West, which helped to fuel the debt crisis.Â  The practice has also created more global pollution as cleaner Western factories have been closed down and replaced by Asian factories powered by coal and producing 'dirtier' byproducts.
